image.altText: Trump holds up the executive order while his commerce secretary stands behind him with a grin

props.synopsis: Australia will not be granted an exemption from the Trump administration's 25 per cent tariffs on aluminium and steel imports, the White House says.

title.children: Trump rejects Australia's bid for tariff exemptions

image.altText: A man looks out the round window of a plane

props.synopsis: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. confirms Rodrigo Duterte is on his way to the International Criminal Court after his arrest in Manila.

title.children: Former Philippine president Rodrigo Duterte arrested over 'war on drugs'

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy gestures as he talks to media

props.synopsis: Representatives from both countries reached the agreement after talks in the Saudi capital of Jeddah.

title.children: Breaking: Ukraine ready to accept ceasefire as US lifts weapons block

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump wearing a white shirt, blue suit jacket and yellow tie

props.synopsis: The US president's announcement is the latest move in the intensifying trade war between the United States and its northern neighbour.

title.children: Trump escalates trade war with Canada, doubling steel and aluminium tariffs

image.altText: A close up image of Peter Dutton speaking.

props.synopsis: A political furore in the wake of revelations the caravan terror plot was a hoax has deepened, with Opposition Leader Peter Dutton hitting back at claims he deliberately missed AFP briefings on the issue.

title.children: Caravan hoax fallout deepens as Dutton hits back on claims he 'stoked fear'

image.altText: Drone image of Wharton Beach, where the shark attack took place.

props.synopsis: Authorities have not been able to recover the body of surfer Steven Jeffrey Payne after he was fatally attacked by a shark at Wharton Beach, near Esperance on Monday.

title.children: Melbourne surfer in fatal shark attack at WA beach identified

image.altText: Man throwing rubbish into a burn pit.

props.synopsis: While America has recognised that military burn pits used in Afghanistan can cause cancer and other illnesses in soldiers, Australia has not accepted it.

title.children: Soldiers who served in Afghan War suffering serious health issues from burn pit exposure

image.altText: a woman and a man smiling to the camera with Adelaide Oval lit up in the background at night

props.synopsis: Luke Sweetman had so much of his life ahead of him when he was punched in a "horrific attack" outside a suburban Adelaide hotel last year. Now, his family has confronted his killer.

title.children: One-punch victim's family confront 'unhinged and volatile' killer

image.altText: A sketch of a man with a beard wearing a turban

props.synopsis: A jury has heard an undercover recording of the man accused of a Queensland woman's violent beachside murder, in which he says he witnessed the "killers" and ran for his life.

title.children: Jury hears covert recording of Toyah Cordingley's accused killer

image.altText: The World Health Organization logo on a plaque

props.synopsis: A staff memo has revealed the latest in a series of cost-cutting measures at the UN agency since Donald Trump's decision to with the US from the organisation.

title.children: World Health Organization announces cost cutting after US withdraws funding

image.altText: A charred grassy embankment cluttered with debris and a burnt skeleton of a tree in front of an orange plume of smoke

props.synopsis: At least 91 drones have targeted the Russian capital, killing multiple people, sparking fires, closing airports and forcing dozens of flights to be diverted, Russian officials say.

title.children: Ukraine launches biggest drone attack on Moscow ahead of peace talks

image.altText: A port with a rocky background.

props.synopsis: A militant group says it bombed the rail line before taking passengers on a train hostage in Balochistan province.

title.children: Militants bomb tracks before taking train passengers hostage

image.altText: Empty supermarket shelves

props.synopsis: Supermarkets across Queensland grapple with grocery shortages in the wake of the natural disaster, with flooding expected to affect the supply of fresh vegetables in the coming months.

title.children: Supermarket shelves stripped bare far from TC Alfred impact zone

image.altText: A man poses in a photo.

props.synopsis: Strike Force Pearl detectives have charged 14 people with dozens of offences in connection with a spate of antisemitic incidents across Sydney.

title.children: Man accused of orchestrating antisemitic arson attacks fronts court

image.altText: Donald Trump points at reporters through a doorway on Air Force One

props.synopsis: There is a real possibility the world's biggest economy is heading toward a recession and it is threatening to drag the world's biggest share market into a crash.

title.children: Is Trump's plan to 'make America great again' about to push it into recession?

image.altText: A red ship with a black hole through it out at sea

props.synopsis: Authorities say one of the vessels involved in the crash is likely to sink, as authorities presume one of the sailors missing since the collision is dead.

title.children: UK police arrest man after cargo ship and tanker collision

image.altText: A soldier in camouflage fatigues and balaklava stands on a raised platform armed with a an AK-47 gun.

props.synopsis: The ABC journeyed into Syria's coastal city of Tartous, where deadly clashes between militias loyal to the fallen regime of Bashar al-Assad and government forces have spiralled into some of the worst violence in the country in years.

title.children: A huge massacre allegedly happened in Syria. Here's what we know

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Makoto Uchida standing in a dark grey suit at a white desk with a Nissan corporate logo while holding a white binder

props.synopsis: The Japanese automaker has revealed multiple executives will resign from their positions after talks with Honda to create the world's third-largest car manufacturer fell flat.

title.children: Nissan CEO to step down after failed Honda merger talks

image.altText: An x-ray of a baby who swallowed a button battery.

props.synopsis: Baby Adèle is now on the road to recovery, but two months ago she was in intensive care after swallowing a button battery, leaving her parents completely petrified and fearing "she might not make it".

title.children: Button battery nightmare prompts parents to keep technology sealed

image.altText: Mark Carney standing behind a podium delivering a speech in front of the Canadian flag

props.synopsis: Canada’s next prime minister steps into the role with no prior political experience but a distinguished career in global finance.

title.children: Mark Carney: Canada's answer to Trump's trade war

image.altText: A bus tipped on its side in the middle of a multi-lane road, with people gathered around it

props.synopsis: Passengers have been thrown from a bus during a crash on a South African highway, killing at least 12 people.

title.children: Twelve killed as passengers thrown from bus during South African crash

image.altText: A boy in a green shirt wearing a backpack walks across a train station concourse.

props.synopsis: The mother of one of the four people accused of murdering Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey tells the Supreme Court one of them told her he had "hit a kid with a trolley pole".

title.children: Cassius Turvey murder trial hears one accused admitted hitting 'kid with a trolley pole'

image.altText: A machete

props.synopsis: The ABC understands a ban on machetes will be announced on Wednesday in concert with tougher bail laws in a move to address growing crime rates in the state.

title.children: Victoria to unveil machete ban as part of crime crackdown

image.altText: A headshot of the Dalai Lama, wearing glasses and a yellow shawl

props.synopsis: It marks the first time the Dalai Lama has specified his successor would be born in the "free world", which he describes as outside China.

title.children: Where will the next Dalai Lama be born? Spiritual leader says not in China

image.altText: An artists' impression of the war memorial showing a fighter jet in a large exhibition space.

props.synopsis: Will a massive expansion of the Australian War Memorial allow it to evolve or destroy what makes it special?

title.children: 'Disneyland of war': The war memorial's divisive transformation

image.altText: the outside of a building

props.synopsis: Bally's chair Soo Kim tells The Business he's yet to hear from Star's boss after making an eleventh-hour bid to control the company.

title.children: Star is splitting itself up but US giant Bally's has a different idea

image.altText: Penny Wong  on Terrorgram sanctions

props.synopsis: The foreign minister has responded after the Russian ambassador said there would be "grave consequences" for Australia if it joined a peacekeeping presence in Ukraine.

title.children: Australia 'won't be intimidated' by Russian warning on Ukraine, Wong says

image.altText: Donald Trump and Malcolm Turnbull shake hands.

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull clashes with the ABC as he warns Australia cannot self-censor "for fear of offending the huge ego of Donald Trump", and suggests Anthony Albanese will not be to blame if his government fails to secure tariff exemptions.

title.children: In tetchy ABC interview, Turnbull says Australia cannot self-censor to please Trump

image.altText: Head and shoulder shot of Mike Nahan

props.synopsis: Former WA Liberal leader Mike Nahan blasts his colleagues for failing to provide a "coherent alternative" ahead of the party's latest election rout, saying upper house MPs did not do enough to engage with the community.

title.children: 'Didn't get off their bums': Liberal blame game begins after WA election

image.altText: 25-year-old Canberra man charged with multiple counts of dangerous driving

props.synopsis: ACT Policing releases dash-cam footage allegedly showing a 25-year-old Gungahlin man ramming other cars with his ute and breaking the back window of a moving car while in its tray and repeatedly kicking the driver.

title.children: Police release footage of violent road rage incidents in Canberra

image.altText: Alan Jones wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: A lawyer for veteran broadcaster Alan Jones has called for the all the contact between the state police force and media be disclosed, claiming the information about his 2024 charges were leaked.

title.children: Lawyer says charges 'leaked' to media as part of 'anti-Jones crusade'

image.altText: Lincoln McCarthy lying on the ground, clutching his right knee, grimacing in pain

props.synopsis: Brisbane Lions forward Lincoln McCarthy has suffered an ACL rupture in his right knee, just days before a potential AFL comeback.

title.children: Luckless Lion ruptures ACL again just days before potential AFL comeback

image.altText: A highschool kid punts an american football at sun set, wearing pads and a helmet

props.synopsis: The lead plaintiff in a US class action against Australian punters in American college football says he just wants a level playing field for high school students hoping to get a collegiate scholarship.

title.children: Anti-Australian punting class action plaintiff wants equity for US kids

image.altText: Man wearing a beanie smiles.

props.synopsis: Glenn Ernest Fenwick, 61, was jailed for a maximum of five and a half years after pleading guilty to the manslaughter of Christopher Jarvis, with the judge labelling the killing "brutal, unlawful and dangerous conduct".

title.children: Man sentenced over 'brutal' 2006 killing of Christopher Jarvis
